textos_fuente.text: Ray's Miami | Hometown bar serving bites, beers and cocktails Skip to content Toggle Navigation Freehand Freehand North America Chicago Los Angeles Miami New York Generator North America Miami New York Washington DC Generator Europe Amsterdam Barcelona Berlin Copenhagen Dublin Hamburg London Madrid Paris Rome Stockholm Venice Special Offers Eat & Drink Magazine MIAMI MENU Freehand Miami Photo Gallery Special Offers Rooms Eat & Drink ▼ Overview Broken Shaker Ray’s Events & Activities Miami City Guide Private Events Business at Freehand Group Bookings FAQs Accessibility Skip to Local Menu Skip to Book a Room Button Toggle Navigation DESTINATIONS North America North America Europe Chicago Los Angeles Miami New York Miami New York Washington DC Amsterdam Barcelona Berlin Copenhagen Dublin Hamburg London Madrid Paris Rome Stockholm Venice SPECIALS EAT & DRINK MAGAZINE Ray’s 2025-03-27T16:36:12-04:00 2727 Indian Creek Dr., Miami Beach, FL 33140 | For all inquiries please email fb.fhmia@thefreehand.com RAY'S HOMETOWN BAR MIAMI A HOMETOWN BAR SERVING BITES, BEERS AND COCKTAILS WITH A DISCO BALL AND POOL TABLE. Operated by Authentic Hospitality, Ray's joined Freehand Miami in December 2024 as a laid back watering hole for locals and out of towners alike. Inspired by the comforting familiarity of small town bars found across America, Ray's serves up a laid back of classic bar staples done well seven days a week. FOOD & BEVERAGE MENU MAKE A RESERVATION EXPERIENCE EXPERIENCE Hours of Operation Monday & Sunday: 5pm – 12am Tuesday to Thursday: 5pm – 2am Friday & Saturday: 5pm – 4am IN THE NEWS "A vibe that's totally its own – where everyone feels at home" – VOGUE, 2024 PLAN YOUR EVENT AT FREEHAND MIAMI PLANNING AN EVENT? OUR SALES TEAM IS READY TO ASSIST. Freehand Miami has several event spaces that are ideal for groups of 10 to 500. Our Secret Garden event space hosts cocktails for up to 150 or a dinner for up to 60. Broken Shaker and Ray's are both available for cocktail receptions, seated dinners, activations, film & photoshoots, all day meetings and more. Group bookings are also available. Contact our sales team for more information. PLAN YOUR EVENT RAY'S HOMETOWN BAR MIAMI 2727 INDIAN CREEK DR. A.Ray Hospitality | Passion for Hospitality top of page HOME Our Brands About Our People CONTACT News & Press More... Use tab to navigate through the menu items. NaShville's un-restaurant company with a passion for hospitality Our brands 02 Our Brands ABOUT Overview & Philosophy A.Ray Hospitality is Nashville’s “un-restaurant” company. We build brands that are resilient, approachable and timeless while creating experiences for our neighbors that blur the line between restaurant and bar. Each of our concepts represents a comfortable “third place” where our neighbors can unwind and socialize outside of the home or office. Our guests don’t need a special occasion or big plans to visit our restaurants. Our casual atmosphere, simple and delicious food, fresh drinks, and neighborly service make every day the perfect day to dine with us. We own Nashville’s greatest places to get out without getting fancy. Brand Focus We only create focused and memorable brands. The experiences we deliver connect with our guests on an emotional level. We achieve this by creating concepts that are familiar, timeless, comfortable, and visually stimulating with a culture that transcends generations. Our brands are simultaneously classic and innovative. Culture & Values Empathy + Action = Hospitality, and our passion is hospitality. We constantly strive to see our businesses through the eyes of our guests and our team members, but with each decision we make, we focus on finding the balance between the guest, the team, and the business. Our leadership believes in nurturing teams that are empowered to create their own destiny, measure their results, cultivate “A” players, and fully understand the implications of their actions. We are respectful yet direct, team oriented, results driven, and transparent. Together we celebrate our wins, examine our losses, and communicate openly on all levels. ​ Our FAMILY VALUES are at t he core of everything we do: Treat Everyone Like a Good Neighbor We surround ourselves with only the BEST to care for our guests, tea m and vendors as if we expect to see them again and again. ​ Play to Win We make things happen and search for solutions together. ​ Details Matter Relentless commitment to high-quality standards and systems. ​ Let's Goooo!!!!! We live for spreading joy and creating memories. We always look for ways to celebrate our wins, each other, and our guests. About Our People Our People​ Austin ray President & Founder austin@arayhospitality.com Austin Ray has been a Nashville-based restaurateur since 2003. Ray is the owner and founder of M.L.Rose Craft Beer and Burgers: an award-winning neighborhood pub concept with four locations in the greater Nashville area, and A.Ray Hospitality, a restaurant, consulting, and real estate holding company. He is also operating partner at Von Elrod's Beer Hall & Kitchen. He entered the hospitality scene at 23 years old as co-owner and developer of the posh nightclub Bar Twenty3 and 1200-person capacity music venue City Hall in 2003. Ray has a bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Administration from Boston University. In addition to regular giving at the community level through the Martha O’Bryan center and other organizations, Ray has been a regular mentor through Big Brothers Big Sisters since 2008. tom perry Chief Operating OfficeR tom.perry@arayhospitality.com Tom Perry has served as the Chief Operating Officer for A.Ray since September 2015. Growing up in small town in the Midwest, Perry developed a passion for people, development and the service industry. He honed this passion with studies at The Ohio State University as well as studying abroad. Joining Team A.Ray, Perry is able to capitalize on his corporate education and experience while reconnecting with his roots in the industry, working for independent, people-driven restaurants and bars. Prior to joining Team A.Ray, Perry held several corporate leadership positions in operations and training at some of the industry leaders such as Chili’s, Red Robin, O’Charley’s, Bar Louie and Aramark at the University of Tennessee. He has also supervised over 50 new restaurant openings for various brands throughout the Southeast. From serving as a board member for the Tennessee Chapter of Habitat for Humanity to being a certified disaster shelter manager for the American Red Cross, Perry believes in giving back. Dunny Wanstrath Chief Financial Officer Dunny.wanstrath@arayhospitality.com Dunny's breadth of experience in multiple functions and sectors combined with his ability to build relationships and interface with all stakeholders is a huge asset to the A.Ray Hospitality leadership team. His background in hospitality is extensive. As part of the in-house M&A group at Brinker International, he helped close over $800mm worth of franchises, including Chili's, On The Border, Macaroni Grill, and Maggiano's. He worked as a finance executive at EY London while simultaneously founding Lonestar Group, a multi-brand restaurant group. And back in the States, he was responsible for the restructuring and turnaround of Cornbread Ventures, a multi-brand, multi-state restaurant holding group. Dunny graduated from University of Arkansas with a degree in Business Administration and received his MBA from UT Dallas with a focus in finance and accounting. Dunny has served as CFO of A.Ray Hospitality since April 2022. katy sanders Marketing Director katy.sanders@arayhospitality.com Katy Sanders, a Tennessee native and University of Tennessee at Chattanooga alumna, holds a BS in Marketing. Her professional journey began at CraftWorks Restaurants & Breweries, Inc., where she started as a Marketing Coordinator and rose to the role of Brand Director for Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery, one of CraftWorks' flagship brands. In 2012, Sanders transitioned to the consumer packaged goods sector before ultimately returning to her roots in the restaurant industry. Currently serving as the Marketing Director for A.Ray Hospitality, she brings a wealth of experience and a passion for elevating brands to the team. Anna Mason VP of People Experience Anna.Mason@arayhospitality.com Anna Mason is the Director of Training at A.Ray Hospitality. Mason grew up in small town Virginia, getting to experience the history and culture of different areas of the state that sparked a lifelong love for learning. Picking up a part time job at Logan’s Roadhouse while finishing up her undergraduate education degree, led to combining her love of learning with a passion for teaching team members how to create a great guest experience. Prior to joining A.Ray Hospitality, Mason held various roles in corporate restaurants working in both operations and training, first for Logan’s Roadhouse, then CraftWorks Holdings, and finally as the Director of Shared Services at SPB Hospitality before joining the A.Ray team. Joining team A.Ray has allowed Mason to capitalize on the experience she gained from her time in the corporate restaurant world in developing training systems, while allowing her to have the honor of working for a company that is true to their culture. RoseAnn Siciliano Sr Director of Operations for M.L.Rose roseann.siciliano@mlrose.com After graduating from Cornell University, RoseAnn Siciliano began her career in NYC’s lively hospitality and musical entertainment scene, where she fostered her passion for culture and community. In 2013, RoseAnn moved to Nashville and started her A.Ray journey at the original M.L.Rose on 8th Ave in the Melrose neighborhood. She has since held multiple leadership positions within the company and plays a central role in opening new locations for the brand. RoseAnn was promoted to Director of Operations of M.L.Rose Craft Beer & Burgers in 2019. latest news View All News Food Notes: M.L.Rose taps Murfreesboro for eighth location A Collage of Familiar Faces,M.L.Rose Grows in Nashville M.L.Rose Craft Beer & Burgers to open Inglewood location M.L.ROSE CRAFT BEER & BURGERS TO OPEN IN GALLATIN CONTACT hello@arayhospitality.com Donation Requests 408 38th Ave N, Nashville, TN 37209 Team Member Suggestions Apply to Work with us CONTACT US Get In Touch Success! South Carolina Stingrays | Front Office South Carolina Stingrays Tickets Single Game Tickets Full Season Tickets Weekender Plan Flex Plan Tickets Group Tickets Hospitality Areas Specialty Ticket Packages Birthday Parties My Account Manager Schedule Schedule & Promotions 2025-26 Printable Schedule 2025-26 Printable Promo Calendar Gameday Info Know Before You Go Game Day Fan Experiences FAQ Stingrays App Watch / Listen Game Notes Team News & Info News Roster Hockey Operations Standings Statistics Front Office Employment Affiliates Community Community Assist of the Game Community Initiatives and Programs Booster Association Partners NHL Street Cool Ray Corner Shop Contact Us Schedule Get Tickets Ticket Categories Single Game Tickets Full Season Tickets Weekender Plan Flex Plan Group Tickets Hospitality Areas Group Experiences Specialty Ticket Packages Birthday Parties Toggle Menu Schedule Tickets Single Game Tickets Full Season Tickets Weekender Plan Flex Plan Tickets Group Tickets Hospitality Areas Specialty Ticket Packages Birthday Parties My Account Manager Schedule Schedule & Promotions 2025-26 Printable Schedule 2025-26 Printable Promo Calendar Gameday Info Know Before You Go Game Day Fan Experiences FAQ Stingrays App Watch / Listen Game Notes Team News & Info News Roster Hockey Operations Standings Statistics Front Office Employment Affiliates Community Community Assist of the Game Community Initiatives and Programs Booster Association Partners NHL Street Cool Ray Corner Shop Contact Us Home Front Office Front Office Management Todd Halloran Principal Owner & Governor Todd became the majority owner of the Stingrays in April 2018 through his investment entity Halloran Sports Group LLC. Todd is a Senior Advisor at Freeman Spogli & Co., a Los Angeles and New York-based private equity firm with approximately $2 billion under management. Todd is also the CEO of Fox Hall Partners, an investment holding company with interests in sports teams, sports tech, health, and tech-enabled consumer product and service companies. Todd has worked with and served on the board of directors for a number of public and private companies and non-profit organizations. He currently serves on the boards of four private companies, the Charleston Metro Chamber of Commerce, the Charleston Regional Development Alliance, and The Community Fund. Todd currently splits his time mostly in Charleston and CT/NY. He and his family are passionate hockey fans. Todd grew up playing hockey in a skating family and has four children who all grew up playing the sport including one currently playing collegiate hockey. Rob Concannon President & Alternate Governor Rob Concannon is in his 16th season as the President of the South Carolina Stingrays. Born and raised in Dorchester, MA, just outside of Boston, Concannon has always been passionate about hockey. He played for the Stingrays from 1995 to 2000, was a member of the 1997 Kelly Cup Championship team, and was inducted into the Stingrays Hall of Fame in 2004. He skated in 350 games for the Stingrays and is currently seventh in all-time Stingrays points with 254 (120 goals, 134 assists). Prior to turning pro, Concannon was a Division III All-American in 1995 with Salem State College. In addition to the Stingrays, Concannon skated for the Saint John Flames and St. John Maple Leafs of the American Hockey League (AHL) and the Idaho Steelheads and Greenville Grrrowl of the ECHL during his eight-year professional hockey career. After retiring from hockey, Rob continued to dedicate his career to the sport. He became the Stingrays’ President and Alternate Governor in 2009 and was elected as head of the ECHL Rules Committee in 2013. Under his leadership, the Stingrays reached the Kelly Cup Finals in 2015, 2017, and 2021, and the Conference Finals in 2016. The team also increased revenue in Season Ticket Sales, Groups Sales, and Corporate Sales during nine straight seasons. In 2018 Concannon was named GM of the Year by the ECHL's coaches and General Managers. The Stingrays won the ECHL's Team Excellence Award for the first time in franchise history under his leadership at the conclusion of the 2018-2019 season. He is very active in the Charleston community working with the Ronald Mcdonald House, Charleston Youth Development Center, MUSC Children’s Hospital, the City of North Charleston, and numerous other organizations and nonprofits. Rob has called Charleston home for the last 29 years and lives downtown with his wife Keri and their twins, John Robert and Ella Loraine. In his free time, Rob likes to exercise and golf. Kerri White SVP Corporate Partnerships Kerri joined the Stingrays in May of 2023 and oversees all corporate partnership efforts. A veteran in professional sports, Kerri spent 16.5 years with the Arizona Diamondbacks corporate partnership team after stops with the Toledo Mud Hens Baseball Club and the Detroit Tigers. During her time with the D-backs, Kerri built marketing platforms with top national and local brands and was also a part of key signature promotions and events such as the Fry’s D-backs Rewards Program, the Bullpen Carts, and the MVP Corporate Partner Awards show. Kerri moved to the Charleston area from Phoenix in 2022 to be closer to family in the Boston, Massachusetts area where she was born and raised. When not at games or watching sports, Kerri can either be found traveling, visiting an ocean (Folly Beach is a favorite), listening to music or cooking. Sam Bays SVP Sales and Marketing Sam joined the Stingrays in March of 2022. In Sam’s 19 years in professional sports he has had stops in Oklahoma City as Vice President of Sales & Service for the Energy FC, in Phoenix as Vice President of Business Development for the Arizona Coyotes, and in Dallas as Director of Sales & Service for the Dallas Stars. Prior to starting his career in professional sports, Sam led the sales team for an international collectables distribution company for 10 years. Altogether he brings over 30 years of sales and service expertise to the Stingrays. Sam is originally from Dallas, Texas and has a Bachelors Degree in History from the University of Texas at Arlington. When he isn’t working, Sam is most likely listening to his collection of vinyl records or spending quality time with his wife Brandy and her three kids along with their dog Natalie. Julie Thoennes Office Manager Julie Thoennes enters her 32nd season with the Stingrays as Office Manager. She is the only member of the Stingrays organization that has been with the club since its inception in 1993. In addition to handling accounts receivable, accounts payable, payroll and the day-to-day responsibilities of the front office, she assists the team’s coaching staff with player operations which include worker’s compensation and immigration issues. She was inducted into the Stingrays Hockey Hall of Fame in 2011. Thoennes resides in Summerville with her husband Larry. They have three sons, Chasen, Charles and Greg. Ticket Sales Kyle Huckabee Director of Ticket Operations Kyle Huckabee joined the Stingrays in 2012 and serves as the team's Director of Ticket Operations, overseeing box office operations at the North Charleston Coliseum on game nights. Kyle previously served as the team's Ticket Sales Manager for three seasons and was a finalist for the 2014-15 ECHL Ticket Executive of the Year. A native of Charleston, South Carolina, Kyle received a Bachelor of Science Degree in Business Administration from the College of Charleston. He grew up in Summerville, South Carolina, and attended Stingrays hockey games for many years prior to working with the team. Kyle enjoys golfing around town in his free time and currently resides in Summerville with his wife Marcy and their son Aaron. His favorite sports teams are the USC Gamecocks, the Atlanta Braves, and of course, the Stingrays. Matt Ellard Senior Account Executive Matt joined the Stingrays in June of 2021. Originally from Tuscaloosa, Alabama, Matt is an avid sports fan and loves University of Alabama athletics, the Houston Astros, and the Pittsburgh Steelers and Penguins. While attending Shelton State Community College, Matt pitched for the Buccaneers and helped lead them to back-to-back NJCAA World Series Appearances. He then went on to graduate from the University of Alabama with a BA in Communication Studies. Matt, his wife Lauren, and their doodle, Finn, recently moved from Atlanta, Georgia to make their home in Charleston. When not cheering on the Stingrays, Matt can be found attending sporting events and concerts, golfing, and spending time with family and friends. Katie Coffey Account Executive This is Katie's third season with the Stingrays as an Account Executive after working at News 2. Katie attended East Carolina University where she studied Marketing with a minor in Political Science. While studying at ECU, she was a member of Alpha Xi Delta where she held the position of Campus Relations Director. Born and raised in the Charlotte area, Katie has always been a Carolina Hurricanes fan. When Katie isn't working, she enjoys pilates, hanging out with friends, and trying new cocktails for her Instagram page, Our Drink Diary! Alex Ostendorff Account Executive This is Alex’s first season with the South Carolina Stingrays as an Account Executive. Breaking into the sports industry has been a longtime goal of his, and he couldn’t be more excited to begin his journey with the team. Alex was born and raised in Greenville, South Carolina, and earned his Bachelor's degree in Marketing from the College of Charleston in the Spring of 2024. A lifelong sports fan, Alex is passionate about the energy and connection that sports bring to communities. In his free time, he enjoys playing golf, working out, exploring the Charleston area, and spending time with friends and family. Kaitlyn Krieg Account Executive This is Kaitlyn Krieg’s first season with the Stingrays as an Account Executive, joining the team in 2025. Born and raised in Denver, Colorado, Kaitlyn attended Wittenberg University, where she majored in Marketing and Communication. During her time there, she played on the collegiate soccer team, was a member of the Delta Gamma sorority, and served as the founding president of the National Society of Leadership and Success (NSLS) on campus. Since graduating, Kaitlyn has worked in marketing for small local businesses and most recently in member relations at The Longevity Club. She also recently earned her personal training certification and completed her second marathon in April. In her free time, Kaitlyn enjoys sunrise beach runs, surfing at Folly Beach, or simply relaxing by the water. When visiting home in Colorado, she loves skiing, hiking, and trail running in the mountains. Corporate Partnerships Mario Picciotto Director of Corporate Partnerships Mario is entering his seventh season with the Stingrays, and third as Business Development Manager after beginning his time with the team as an Account Executive. Originally from a small town in Pennsylvania, Mario has been an avid hockey fan and player since he was the age of 10. To continue to promote his love of the game and passion for sports, Mario achieved his Master's degree in Sports Management from Old Dominion University in 2019. At ODU, he gained experience working as a graduate assistant in Game Operations for all of the university's sports teams. He also spent four years working part-time as an Account Executive for the Norfolk Tides baseball team, a professional minor league baseball team in the Triple-A International League. Mario has made Charleston his home, joining his two sisters, parents and three nieces. He lives on James Island and enjoys golfing, lifting and spending family time at the beach. Don Johnson Corporate Activation Manager Don joins the Stingrays for his first season as the Corporate Partner Activation Manager. Born and raised in Randleman, North Carolina, Don grew up playing and coaching hockey. In an effort to further his future and pursue a career in hockey, Don attended North Carolina State University where he obtained his Bachelor of Science degree in Sport Management. After graduating, Don gained experience as a Production Coordinator at Oklahoma State University and as the Director of Gameday Operations at the Carolina Thunderbirds, a Federal Prospects Hockey League team based out of Winston-Salem, NC. When not watching sports, Don spends his time playing hockey and golf or lifting weights. Marketing and Communications Kathryn Canfield Manager of Marketing and Creative Services This is Kathryn’s second season with the Stingrays as the Manager of Marketing and Creative Services. Kathryn was born and raised in Portland, Oregon and moved to Charleston in August 2024 to be a part of the team. Kathryn went to school in McMinnville, Oregon at Linfield University where she earned her Bachelor's degree in the Spring of 2023 and her Master’s in Business and Sport Leadership in the Spring of 2024. During her time at Linfield, Kathryn discovered her passion for sports marketing and the dynamic and lively energy that comes with it. In her free time Kathryn loves to snowboard (which she won’t get much of here anymore), explore the Charleston area, and spending time with friends and family. Michael Cook Game Operations Director Michael Cook is entering his fifth season with the South Carolina Stingrays, where he serves as the Director of Game Operations. Originally from Lorton, Virginia, Michael is a lifelong hockey fan and proud Washington Capitals supporter. He studied Recreation and Sport Management at Coastal Carolina University, where he discovered his passion for video production and game entertainment while working with the Coastal Athletics Department. In his role with the Stingrays, Michael focuses on delivering a smooth, engaging game-night experience. Bringing together entertainment, energy, and attention to detail to create a show fans look forward to every night. Sara Newton Graphic Designer and Digital Production Manager Sara is excited to begin her first season with the South Carolina Stingrays as the Graphic Designer and Digital Production Manager. She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Musical Theatre from Christopher Newport University and hails from Fredericksburg, VA, where her enthusiasm for sports was ignited by frequent visits to Fredericksburg Nationals baseball games. With an extensive background in content creation and sports marketing, Sara’s experience includes serving as the Marketing Assistant and Videographer for the FredNats in 2024. Now transitioning from the diamond to the rink, she brings a fresh, innovative perspective to her role with the Stingrays. Outside of her professional pursuits, Sara enjoys exploring Charleston, soaking up the sun at the beach, and spending quality time with friends. Brendan Reilly Manager of Communications and Broadcasting. Brendan joins the Stingrays for his first season as the Manager of Communications and Broadcasting. Originally from Connecticut, Brendan has had a passion for sports his entire life. Brendan attended the University of Miami where he earned his degree in Broadcast Journalism while gaining experience calling Hurricanes football, basketball and baseball. After graduation, Brendan moved to Winston-Salem, NC where he broadcasted for the Carolina Thunderbirds of the Federal Prospects Hockey League and the Winston-Salem Dash, the High-A Affiliate of the Chicago White Sox. Brendan moved to Charleston in 2025 and spends his time golfing, hanging with friends, and traveling. Community and Merchandise Kelvin Jones Director of Retail Operations Kelvin is entering his third season with the South Carolina Stingrays and serves as the Director of Retail Operations. Originally from Atlanta, GA, Kelvin grew up a huge football and basketball fan. Kelvin graduated from Georgia Southern University in 2020 with a degree in Sports Management with a minor in Business. During his time at Georgia Southern he was heavily involved in the Eagles athletic department as he was a Recruiting Assistant for the football team and interned for the Athletic Marketing program. Kelvin then relocated to Florence, SC where he served two seasons as the Director of Operations for the Florence Flamingos. Kelvin currently lives in Summerville, SC. In his free time, he enjoys hanging with friends, watching sports and spending time with his wife, Hannah, and two cats, Milo and Boba. Sara Shamlin Community Relations & Game Day Promotions Manager This is Sara’s second season with the Stingrays as Community Relations Manager. Sara was raised on Florida’s Space Coast and is an avid sports fan. She moved to Charleston in 2023 to work as an intern with the Stingrays and has enjoyed learning about the team and the area. Sara has a Bachelor’s degree in Advertising and Public Relations from the University of Central Florida where she completed internships with the UCF Athletic Department working with the Basketball and Track and Field teams. She grew up regularly attending the Jacksonville Jaguar games and enjoys supporting her favorite professional teams. Sara currently lives in James Island and when not working enjoys going to Folly Beach, reading a good book or hanging out with friends. Join The Stingrays Front Office Team Employment Opportunities (Teamwork Online) Seasonal Employment Opportunities Contact The Stingrays The South Carolina Stingrays Office is located on Etna Street in North Charleston, just a short walk from the North Charleston Coliseum where the Stingrays play all home games. Our Front Office staff is available in person or via the phone from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday-Friday. Hours are subject to change and may vary on home game dates. Restaurants Authentic Hospitality Bringing Ray’s Hometown Bar to Freehand Miami Ray’s Hometown Bar will replace 27 Restaurant & Bar Published Date: November 22, 2024, 2:00 PM EST Written By Neil Cooney News Writer Share Photo: Official SHARE Last summer, the Miami New Times reported that Broken Shaker at the Freehand Miami , a beloved backyard hangout, had been sold, together with adjacent restaurant 27 Restaurant & Bar . Now operated by Generator Hotels and the New York -based Authentic Hospitality Group , the future of these two concepts—thrown briefly into doubt—has become clear. Follow-up reporting by the New Times explains that Broken Shaker is going through a makeover, but that Generator and Freehand Hotels CEO Alastair Thomann and Authentic Hospitality partner Matt Kliegman have “assured worried guests that although there [will] be some upgrades and changes made to the Broken Shaker, they aimed to keep the spirit intact and the bar open” back in July. 27 Restaurant & Bar Closed back in September, and it has now been revealed that it will be replaced by a new outpost of Authentic Hospitality’s Ray’s Hometown Bar . It will be the third location for Ray’s Bar, and its first outside New York. What Now reached out to Matt Kliegman to inquire about plans for the new Ray’s and the details on its menu. Kliegman declined to comment at this time. The retro-style bar is “ A friendly place to hang your hat !” It serves a selection of cocktails named for famous Rays: the Brooklyn menu features cocktails like the Ray’s Manhattan (In Brooklyn), with Great Jones Rye Whiskey, Carpano Antica Sweet Vermouth, and Agnostura; the Raymond Chandler, with Hendrick’s Gin, grapefruit, lemon, and soda; and the Carly Rae Jepsen, with Angel’s Envy Bourbon, Juliette Peach Liqueur, and Lemon. On the “Chow” side is a selection of appetizers, sandwiches, and desserts. You can keep up with Ray’s Bar news by following @raysbarnyc on Instagram. 2727 Indian Creek Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33140 Be the First to Know From new restaurant openings to exciting retail launches and real estate insights, be the first to know what’s happening in Miami Subscribe & Stay Ahead Share This Article Facebook Copy Link Print By Neil Cooney Follow: Neil Cooney is a freelance writer. He has received an MFA in Creative Writing from Syracuse University, and his work has been published in the Masters Review. Based in Nashville, he spends his free time cooking Korean food and studying chess.
